Structure:
[[again]]:
[ [ the door open] again]
‘The opposite of P, P, has happened before.‚
imtwordsbare: ‘The opposite of P, P, has happened before.‚
trs: Overall interpretation: counterdirectional ‘The door opened, and earlier, it had closed.

html:
Structure:
[[again]]:
[ ø [ [ the door open] again]]
‘The same thing has happened before.’
trs: Overall interpretation: restitutive ‘The door opened, and earlier, the door had been open.

p₂ while p₁:
λw.λt.∃t₁t₂[t₁⊆t & t₂⊆t & p₁(w,t₁) & p₂(w,t₂) & t₂⊆t₁]
trs: p₁ occured and p₂ occured and the time of p₂ is included in the time of p₁

html:
p₂ because p₁:
λw.p₁(w) & p₂(w) & CAUSE(p₁,p₂)
trs: p₁ occured and p₂ occured and p₁ caused p₂’ (i.e. if p₁ hadn’t occurred, p₂ wouldn’t have)
